DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.title: Capture User ID in Payload
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.description: As an automation engineer, I want the system to capture and include the user_id in the data payload so that audit trails and user-specific actions can be accurately tracked and analyzed.
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.acceptance_criteria:
- The system includes a valid user_id field in every payload transmitted.
- The user_id corresponds to the authenticated automation engineer initiating the action.
- If the user_id is missing or invalid, the system generates an error and prevents payload transmission.
- The captured user_id is logged and can be audited for traceability.
- The feature does not disrupt existing payload fields or data integrity.

- The feature does not disrupt existing payload fields or data integrity.

DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.title: Capture user_id in API payloads
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.description: As an automation engineer, I want the system to capture and include the user_id in all payloads so that user actions can be accurately tracked and audited.
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.acceptance_criteria:
- The system includes a valid user_id field in every outgoing payload.
- Payloads without a user_id are rejected or flagged for correction.
- The user_id captured matches the authenticated user's identifier.
- Logs record the user_id associated with each payload transmission.
- Error handling gracefully manages cases where user_id is missing or invalid.

DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.title: Capture user_id in payload for tracking
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.description: As a automation engineer, I want the system to capture user_id in the payload so that user actions can be accurately tracked and correlated with system events.

- User_id field is populated with the correct and unique identifier of the logged-in user.
- Payload containing user_id can be successfully processed by downstream systems without errors.
- Error handling occurs if user_id is missing or invalid, with appropriate logs created.
- System documentation is updated to reflect the inclusion of user_id in the payload structure.

DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.title: Capture user_id in payload for tracking
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.description: As an automation engineer, I want the system to capture and include the user_id in the payload so that I can accurately trace user actions and improve auditing and debugging processes.
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.acceptance_criteria:
- The system includes a valid user_id field in every relevant payload.
- The user_id captured corresponds to the authenticated user initiating the action.
- Payloads without a valid user_id are flagged or rejected.
- The captured user_id persists through linked processes and logs.
- The system handles edge cases such as anonymous or unauthenticated users appropriately, either by omitting the user_id or using a placeholder.

refined_story.title: Capture user_id in payload for tracking
refined_story.description: As an automation engineer, I want the system to capture and include the user_id in the payload so that I can accurately trace user actions and improve auditing and debugging processes.
refined_story.acceptance_criteria:
- The system includes a valid user_id field in every relevant payload.
- The user_id captured corresponds to the authenticated user initiating the action.
- Payloads without a valid user_id are flagged or rejected with a descriptive error message.
- The captured user_id persists through linked processes and is logged correctly in the audit trail.
- The system handles edge cases such as anonymous or unauthenticated users by omitting the user_id or using a placeholder (e.g., 'guest').

REFINER_OUTPUT.refinement_notes: Applied suggestions to refine acceptance criteria for clarity and completeness.

FEATURE_TEXT: OAuth1 login flow for user_id payload

DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.title: Implement OAuth1 Login Flow to Retrieve User ID Payload
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.description: As an automation engineer, I want to implement the OAuth1 login flow that retrieves the user_id payload so that the system can securely authenticate users and obtain their user identifiers for further processing.
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.acceptance_criteria:
- The system supports OAuth1 protocol to initiate and complete user login flow.
- Upon successful authentication, the system retrieves and processes the user_id payload from the OAuth1 response.
- The system handles authentication errors and displays appropriate error messages.
- The login flow maintains security best practices to protect user credentials and tokens.
- Integration tests confirm the user_id payload is correctly extracted during the OAuth1 login process.

FEATURE_TEXT: OAuth1 login flow for user_id payload

DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.title: Implement OAuth1 login flow to handle user_id payload
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.description: As an automation engineer, I want the OAuth1 login flow to correctly process and include the user_id payload so that authentication integrates seamlessly and user sessions are properly managed.
DRAFT_AGENT_OUTPUT.acceptance_criteria:
- The OAuth1 login flow accepts and processes a user_id payload during authentication.
- The system verifies that the user_id corresponds to an existing user before completing login.
- Upon successful login, the user_id is included in the session data for downstream processes.
- Appropriate error messages are displayed if the user_id payload is missing or invalid.
- Login attempts with invalid user_id payloads are securely rejected without exposing sensitive information.
- System logs each login attempt with timestamp, user_id, and outcome for audit purposes.
- OAuth1 token acquisition is performed via an authorization URL that prompts the user for their credentials.
- OAuth1 token validation checks the received token against the authorization server to confirm authenticity and retrieve user information.

refined_story.title: Implement OAuth1 login flow to handle user_id payload
refined_story.description: As an automation engineer, I want the OAuth1 login flow to correctly process and include the user_id payload so that authentication integrates seamlessly and user sessions are properly managed.
refined_story.acceptance_criteria:
- The OAuth1 login flow accepts and processes a user_id payload during authentication.
- The system verifies that the user_id corresponds to an existing user before completing login.
- Upon successful login, the user_id is included in the session data for downstream processes.
- Appropriate error messages are displayed if the user_id payload is missing or invalid.
- Login attempts with invalid user_id payloads are securely rejected without exposing sensitive information.
- System logs each login attempt with timestamp, user_id, and outcome for audit purposes.
- OAuth1 token acquisition is performed via an authorization URL that prompts the user for their credentials.
- OAuth1 token validation checks the received token against the authorization server to confirm authenticity and retrieve user information.
refined_story.feature_title: OAuth1 login flow for user_id payload

REFINER_OUTPUT.refinement_notes: No changes needed - story passed spec validation.
